TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Pour 100 ml of water in a beaker and boil it.
Dip 6 tea bags into the boiling water.
Squeeze all the tea out of the bags.
Take a measuring jar.
Transfer the 15 ml of tea into the measuring jar.
Place a conical funnel on the mouth of the separating funnel. Transfer the tea taken in the measuring jar into a separating funnel clamped in a stand.
Pour 10 ml of dichloromethane into a measuring jar.
Pour this into the separating funnel containing tea through the conical funnel.
We can observe two layers in the separating funnel: Top layer of tea and the bottom layer of dichloromethane.
Close the separating funnel with a stopper.
Remove the funnel from its stand.
Keep your fingers on the stopper and carefully shake the separating funnel.
Vent the separating funnel periodically with the spigot pointing away from you to relieve gas pressure.
Now, drain out the dichloromethane at the bottom layer into a conical flask.
To do the second extraction, pour another 10ml of dichloro methane into the separating funnel as shown.
Mix the tea solution again by gently shaking the separating funnel. Each time make sure to vent the funnel to relieve the gas pressure.
Drain the dichloromethane into the same conical flask again.
Repeat the same procedure for third time: pour another 10ml of dichloromethane into the separating funnel as shown.
Mix the tea solution again by gently shaking the separating funnel. Each time make sure to vent the funnel to relieve the gas pressure.
Again drain the dichloromethane into the same conical flask.
Add the dry agent: anhydrous sodium sulfate to remove the moisture content from tea and methane.
Close the flask and swirl it gently.
Wait for about 10 minutes for the moisture to be absorbed by the sodium sulfate.
Decant the clear solution of dichloromethane into a new conical flask.
Boil the solution for few minutes. After the evaporation, only crude caffeine will be left over.
After the evaporation, only crude caffeine will be left over.
Insert a test tube with a cork into the conical flask containing pure caffeine as shown.
Heat the conical flask at 230ºC as the melting point of the pure caffeine is 235 ºC.
Pure caffeine will be vaporised and get collected in the outer walls of the test tube and on the neck of the conical flask.
Weigh a clean empty watch glass.
The weight of this empty weight glass is 32.2451
Scrub off the adhered caffeine on the walls of the test tube and the conical flask using a spoon to the pre-weighed watch glass.
Weigh the watch glass again on the same balance. The difference between the final weight and the weight of the empty watch glass is the weight of the caffeine.
Obtain a capillary spotter and take a small portion of the sample collected in the watch glass.
Insert the capillary tube into the melting point measurement equipment as shown.
Set the temperature to 200 ºC and observe it through the eye piece to check whether the pure caffeine is melted or not.
